It’s said that somewhere in the world, there’s a mineral vein housing a large pack of slumbering _____. It’s also said that this pack has a queen.
When beset by attackers, _____ wipes them all out by firing high-energy beams from the gems embedded in its body.
To keep the jewels on their bodies free of tarnish, packs of _____ use their soft manes to polish one another’s jewels.
Some say that deep beneath the surface of the world, a pack of _____ live with their queen in a kingdom of jewels.
Although this Pokémon is not especially rare, its glittering, jewel-draped body draws attention from people.
Born from the high temperatures and pressures deep underground, it defends itself by firing beams from the jewel part of its body.
It has slept underground for hundreds of millions of years since its birth. It’s occasionally found during the excavation of caves.
Born from the temperatures and pressures deep underground, it fires beams from the stone in its head.
